Creative writing is a form of artistic expression that uses words to convey emotions, thoughts, and ideas. It can take various forms, including short stories, poetry, and essays. Short stories are brief narratives that typically focus on a single character or event. Poetry, on the other hand, is a form of literature that uses aesthetic and rhythmic qualities of language to evoke emotions. Essays are a type of prose that presents an argument or a point of view. Based on this information, which form of creative writing is most likely to present an argument or a point of view?
A. Short stories
B. Poetry
C. Novels
D. Essays

Based on the information provided, the form of creative writing most likely to present an argument or a point of view is D. Essays. The description mentions that essays are a type of prose that presents an argument or a point of view. Short stories focus on brief narratives, poetry uses language to evoke emotions, and novels are longer fictional works, but essays are specifically described as presenting arguments or points of view.
